Reviews.Title: “E X C E L L E N T ! ! ! !”
Reviews.Author: Valllentina
Reviews.Content: The best place to stay if you are visiting for business or for leisure!!! It is a hidden gem in the heart of Paris ! small hotel five rooms on five floors. Staff is friendly and the service is excellent! Location Location Location. This hotel is right accross the Trocadero metro station. Accross the street from the Chaillot museum on one side and on the other side you get to the place du Trocadero where you can see the EIFFEL tower!! and this is really a good source of relaxation specially at night when the tower is lit and you are having supper in one of the 5 or 7 neighbourhood restaurants It is very accessible to the Paris convention center on 2 porte maillot 18 minutes walking on the same street Pointcarre that becomes Malakoff . Also 22 minutes walking distance to the Arc de Triomphe when you take Kléber and then you head to the Champs Elysées Clean Clean clean!! I went there early march from the 1st to the 6th and this was a great stay!! and I explain Entrance is welcoming and staff is very helpfull. Front desk 24 hrs. Mr Yassin the hotel manager greeted me quickly and the key to the room was ready for me. Mr Mounir was very helpfull when I asked for an info. This hotel is smoke free. There is an elevator. WI FI is free during all your stay! when connected to the hotel. Remember you cannot connect to any WiFi in Paris even if you are in a restaurant or near the Apple store on Champs Elysees or nearby any Orange store ( Internet supplier) you always need a password and an Id plus an authorization.... so I think having a free WiFi is a great plus for business: you stay connected! Rooms are clean, fairley spacious if you compare it to any hotel rooms in Europe. Room service is prompt and effective! No noise what so ever!! I was staying in room 51 far from the street noise. Service is great quick and when you ask about any info they are very helpfull TV, Fridge and a coffee kettle and a choice of tea or coffee. There is extra blankets and beds are made on a daily routine. Beds are comfortable pillows are soft Bathroom is spacious, towels all kinds and toiletteries Roger & Gallet: exfoliant soap and Body and hair shampoo soft almond scent. I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel and would recommend it was it for business purposes or for leisure Checking out was quick and easy with the blond lady ( sorry I forgot her name) Thank you for everything! I will sure stay again at this hotel when my next visit to Paris!!

Reviews.Title: “Great view of the Eifel Tower”
Reviews.Author: M M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Small but warm hotel! Great location, with a metro station across the road. Friendly staff, small but clean rooms, good brekfast! In the morning there was a little bit of noise due to the central location of the hotel. However, I will definetly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A charming little gem in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: PilarVM
Reviews.Content: I have fond memories of the Best Western in Trocadero. It's a charming little hotel in the midst of Paris. The room was small as a lot of European hotel rooms are but it was clean, functional and nice. The service was friendly, the breakfast was good and the location was excellent. I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, small room but superb service”
Reviews.Author: Sarah P
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect hotel for us as we were meeting friends nearby. On arrival, the gentleman behind the desk was really welcoming and was expecting us. Our room was very small, especially with a cot in there too, but it was just what we needed for one night in Paris, and the fantastic view and location more than made up for this. It was clean and had everything we needed and all requests were met. The staff were so helpful towards us and our toddler son, offering food and snacks for him and helping us entertain him as we waited for a taxi!! Very friendly and would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Small but pleasant hotel, superb location”
Reviews.Author: Noyawns
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights here in May 2011, perfect room and polite, helpful staff. The location with the night view of the Eiffel Tower just a few steps outside the lobby was superb, I went out in my PJs at midnight to snap photos! And the metro stop was also just a few steps away, connecting me to Roland Garros in just 6 stops. Bathroom was spacious. Love it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location good hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlexJaymie
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for the location. It was my daughters 6th birthday and she always dreamed of seeing the eiffel tower. Thanks to AniÃ§a on reception we were given a tower view room. The room itself was ok, a little small, although the bathroom was large. The A/C was a real plus for us as was the large lift as we had lots of luggage. The only negative would be the plastic sheet under the bed sheet...most uncomfortable! Breakfast was excellent and continental and the staff were friendly and helpful. Many cafÃ©s, restaurants and bars nearby as well as some small supermarkets. Next to the Metro stop which is obviously very convenient. Would recommend this hotel for the location, not much better in that respect for Paris. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MrSunshine777
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property on several occasions and the rooms are always up to standards. Location is of primary consideration in Paris and this hotel is quite centrally located. Walking distance to the Eiffel Tower, Metro stop handy, Hop-on-off bus tour across the way, restaurants all over... Clean comfortable rooms, nice breakfast. Helpful proprietor.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: CYAMADA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the latter part of July 2011 - this hotel is truly right off the subway (Trocadero stop) and has unobstructed views of the Eiffel Tower. It is only a 10-min walk to get down to the Eiffel Tower from this hotel's location. It is an adequate space if you are looking just to put your bags down and spend the day sightseeing. Found the rooms to be a bit small (and our girls were crammed into one room with barely enough room to move around) but clean and adequate. There are a couple of grocery stores just about a 5 minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing manager who cares like an owner”
Reviews.Author: rezareza
Reviews.Content: In all my travels, few people have been as nice as Mr. Yacine Dermouche, the hotel's director. He is so thoughtful. He exemplifies service at its best. As a walk-in, he found a room for me after a great deal of moving things around; but he was even willing to help arrange a room for me at a different hotel. He contacted Office Depot complaining when he thought they sold me an unnecessary and expensive converter. Aside from the hotel's service, the hotel's location is great and if offers an excellent value for the money. People who say Parisian are rude or give bad service haven't met Mr. Yacine Dermouche. He is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: kimberley90
Reviews.Content: Amazing location close to the Champs Elysees and Eiffel Tower! The hotel itself is lovely - the breakfast is continental and you can eat as little or as much as you want. The rooms are basic but the hotel itself is fantastic. The restaurants across the road are amazing - malakoff i think it was called, was particularly nice. Croque Monsieur for dinner and a chocolate crepe for pudding - I was very French, of course! The food was always spot on and I enjoyed the ambiance as well. If you want to visit Disney, you could take a train directly to the site and it was okay, for a day trip. We were all older, above 15, so it didn't really appeal that much to us. However, Paris itself is fantastic - the shopping is incredible and the food even more so! Would love to go back and see some of the sights we didnt get a chance to take in. I would stay at this hotel again, for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!!!”
Reviews.Author: SerephanandMum
Reviews.Content: With views of the Eiffel Tower from our room, this was a perfect location!!! 30 seconds walk from the metro station, located near a busy corner with lots of cafe's, restaurants and taxi's. Short walk to a clear view of the Eiffel Tower and about 10min walk to stand underneath it!! Very nice staff at reception, no breakfast available but with so many cafe's on the doorstep it didn't matter!!! Rooms were clean, comfortable and modern. Would stay here again if (and hopefully when!!) I return to Paris!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Mari_Castro
Reviews.Content: I have spent 3 nights in this hotel during a business trip. I stayed in room 42 - which has a wonderful view of the tower. The room was cozy, with much space (at least for Paris!). Bed was nice also. The bathroom had been reshaped recently and had a good bathtube. Breakfast was well-served with a sort of bread, marmelade, juices, cheese etc. for a good price: 11 euros / person. Staff was friendly - specially the old man who stays there during the weekends. About the location, the hotel stays a few steps from the subway - Trocadero station. And the neighborhood has a lot of restaurantes and coffee shops. I definetely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: Chris-Redmond
Reviews.Content: I travelled on business and stayed a single night at the Au Trocadero. Decent sized room for Paris and it had a bath as opposed to just a shower cubicle that I've experienced elsewhere in Paris at a similar room rate. Breakfast was standard french fare of cereals, meats, cheeses and pastries and was tasty. Free WIFI was good since I was on business.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly perfect!”
Reviews.Author: pej75
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel - it was great. Smart, very clean, friendly staff, yummy brekky our room was lovely and quiet. The only down side is that due to it being perfectly situated opposite the Eiffel Tower for a nightly wonder for the twinkly lights. It is quite a walk down the river every time you want to go to any of the other tourist bits...If you use the metro then it's fine but otherwise it's a walk. There is a fab restuarant directly opposite the hotel which does fabulous food and try the Profieroles - they were the size of apples and you got 3!!! A first class hotel in a nearly first class location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, price and roomy.”
Reviews.Author: Lynn S
Reviews.Content: The place has a great location right on the Trocadero roundabout, and right across the street from the Trocadero metro station. However, as with all metro stations in depends what exit you come out of the station, because it's possible to end-up on the otherside of the roundabout. From my room I was able to look out and see the Eiffel Tower and my wife and I loved that, catching the tower light show from the room was great. As far as the size of the room I found it to be very spacious both in the room and the bathroom. Not the biggest room I've stayed in, but pleanty of space for my wife and I to both get ready in the morning without any issues. There was a bar in the hotel which has a breakfast in the morning. We tried in one time, for 12 Euro a person, I didn't find it to be worth it, I would recommending getting your breakfast elsewhere. Being in such a central location there are plenty of resturants nearby, 5 fairly well priced (for Paris) places within half a block. The staff was a mix, most of the desk staff spoke english, out of the four I met, only one didn't speak english but between my poor French and some pointing I was able to get through. One of the staff I felt went above and beyond when my wife and I asked him about posting something to the United States, and he said they don't have stamps at the desk, but he would mail it for us after his shift on his way home. The postcard arrived at it's destination, so he was good on his word. I would recommend this place if your looking for a great central location for a fair price. We were within 10 minutes walk of both Arch de Triumph and Eiffel Tower, and easy walking to the Louve and Notre Dame, but everything is close by the metro across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Price, Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheChennaiFoodie
Reviews.Content: I could not have chosen a better location for my trip to Paris. The hotel is located almost bang opposite the metro station exit (on ave Raymond, exit 3) of the Trocadero Station. The trocadero square is 5 mins walk from the hotel and the Eiffel Tower is about 15 mins away. If you are the one to stay late in Paris and love to walk around at night, then this could be essential as this place (in the 16th Arrondosiment) is among the safest in Paris. Trocadero is crowded at 12 midnight, so you can walk from the Eiffel Tower to your hotel at that hour. There a number of cafe's right outside the hotel and the cafe Le Malekof is awesome!! The hotel by itself is alright. The elevator does not work sometimes, staff are not the best in the world, do not expect flower arrangements in your room even if you mention that you will be honeymooning. The cleaning staff were kind of spooky, but the front office staff were very helpful for basic questioning. The rooms are small, but very clean and adequate. The bathroom was well equipped and had a bath tub. The Eiffel tower view rooms, had trees between your room and the tower. The whole package of the location, tour bus stops nearby, metro bang opposite, a host of Parisian cafes near by and the not-so-bad hotel made my stay in Paris a memorable one. I would probably stay in this hotel again unless I make a lot more money and afford a more expensive hotel right next to the Eiffel tower.

Reviews.Title: “No elevator, stayed on 5th floor.”
Reviews.Author: ren284
Reviews.Content: My sister and I were there 4 nights and the elevator worked 1 day plus the time it took to bring our luggage to the fifth floor. When we tried to go downstairs 5 minutes later, it didn't work anymore. Being good tourists, we didn't complain much but when it was time to bring down our 50lbs each bags from the fifth floor, the guy from the hotel didn't want to help us. The staircase is very dangerous and narrow so we would have killed ourselves. In the end, the nightguy decided to help us after we told him about the mean dayguy. They blamed their elevator incompetence on 'major forces' as in the Eiffel tower falls on the hotel or a hurricane blasts Paris off the map. Yeah, good job. And for the clean freaks out there, we found a high heel shoe with a dirty sock under the curtains, very visible for the cleaning lady. Just saying.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for weekend to Paris”
Reviews.Author: TGBWorcestershire
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 3 night weekend break to Paris and stayed at this hotel. It is excellently located - right next to the Trocadero Metro station, surrounded by several restaurants/bars and just a 5 minute walk to the viewing point for the Eiffel Tower and a 15 minute walk to the base of the tower itself. Given the ease of using the metro, the location was fantastic for a weekend break. In terms of the hotel itself it matched our expectations of a central Paris hotel - ie small rooms, but we were pleasantly suprised at the bathroom containing both a shower and a bath. It was also good to have a free-to- use safe and free air conditioning. This was a particularly warm weekend and so the air conditioning was a welcome addition as trying to sleep with the windows open was difficult given the noise from the main road throughout the night . Again this was expected and did mean we had a view of the Eiffel tower - if you looked to the right out of the window! (and we hadn't paid for a tower view room either). The room was very clean and tidy although the bed hadn't been made up when we checked in at 3.30pm - a call to reception rectified this however. Breakfast was included in our deal - it was sufficient with coffee, juice, cereals, bread, cheese, ham, pastries and yoghurt. I think 13 euros (normal rate) would have been expensive for what was on offer, but then so much seemed expensive on this visit!! The staff we encountered were neither overly friendly nor surly, and one gent did try and find the tennis results on the internet for us one evening! I recommend the La Malakoff restaurant (literally across the road from the hotel) for an evening meal as it was both reasonably priced and good quality. Overall, this hotel is in an excellent location for a city break and we felt good value for a city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more for our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: JerseyGirl1981
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western au Trocadero hotel when we went to Paris for a week on our honeymoon. We were expecting a nice, romantic hotel with a view of the Eiffel Tower. Well, the hotel scores one out of three! Here's our take on the hotel: CLEANLINESS We could not fault the cleanliness of the bedroom once it had been made up each morning. We were always given fresh toiletries and had an adequate supply of toilet roll. The only public area of the hotel that we used was the bar/breakfast area and this also seemed spotlessly clean. So 5 stars on this area! LOCATION The location was the primary reason that we booked this hotel and, despite the negative points in this review, we would stay there again next time we visit Paris, purely for the location. There is a Metro station a few steps away, so not far to lug your heavy luggage. There are also several restaurants surrounding the hotel, which we made use of during our stay. If you take your life in your hands and cross the several roads to the Place du Trocadero, you will have one of the best views in Paris of the Eiffel Tower. We had a view of the tower from our bedroom, and you can request this when you book. There is a tour bus stop at Place du Trocadero, too, which takes you around all of the major tourist attractions, so this location is the ideal base from which to explore Paris. ROOMS Having read several reviews about the size of European hotel rooms, we weren't expecting a room the size of Heathrow Terminal 5. The room was small and the windows quite rickety, but we weren't in the room that much to really mind. The double bed was tiny and until I got used to it, I did not get much sleep for the first few nights! The room was very hot at times and we had to leave the windows open at night, although the noise from the streets did make this difficult. We had air conditioning (although I don't think it worked) so make sure that if you go in the spring/summer months, you choose a hotel with air conditioning or it will be unbearable. As far as public areas are concerned, don't expect much. The bar was seldom used and the man on the reception desk had to come and serve us, which judging by his surly look, was a bit more than he was expecting to have to do that evening. One evening we asked for two Coca Colas and were told that they had run out and were told to go to one of the restaurants if we wanted them. At breakfast, unless you get down pretty early, be prepared to share your table with other guests. There are about 5 or 6 small bar tables (you eat in the bar area as the hotel has no restaurant) and that's it, so if you can't find a table, you have to wait until the other guests have finished and their table is cleared. SERVICE ... and now on to the one aspect that really lets this hotel down. We had specified during our booking that this trip was our honeymoon and we were expecting, obviously wrongly, to be treated like we have read about other honeymooners being treated abroad. You know the sort of thing... rose petals on the bed, a bottle of champagne on ice in the room... or failing that, a friendly welcome would have been a start! We received none of these things. We arrived tired and hungry at 7pm and were immediately disappointed by the standard of service we received from the front desk. No welcome, no 'how was your journey' and no offer of help with our bags. We took them up to our room in the lift and went out to find some food, hoping that the next day would be better. Oh, how wrong we could be. We obviously had far too high expectations of European customer service standards, as this unfriendly welcome on the first night seemed to be the norm for the rest of the hotel staff! The waitress at breakfast would not communicate with you unless you spoke to her first, and even then it was more of a grunt than a reply. You could stand in front of her at the bar waiting for service and unless you actually made your presence known by speaking, she would look straight past you. I never saw her smile during the whole week we were there and came to the conclusion that she obviously did not enjoy her job very much at all. The other two receptionists that we encountered during our stay were much the same. Two days before the end of our stay, our room cards had been deactivated for some reason and we had to go down to reception to get them reactivated. No apology, no explanation as to why this had happened, just the usual frustrated look as if we were asking for the moon on a stick! The room cleaners, while good at their job, need some serious work on their customer service skills. It would help if they either spoke English or French, but when speaking to them in our reasonable French, they appeared not to even understand the basics for 'please come back later' and ended up getting stroppy with us! Anyway, we tried not to let this complete lack of friendliness from all of the staff ruin our stay, as luckily we did not spend too much time in the hotel with all of Paris to explore in just one week! VALUE Not the most expensive hotel in Paris but I doubt it is the cheapest, either. We paid for an all-inclusive package which included breakfast and I'm glad we did, as it was certainly not worth the stand-alone price that they seem to get away with charging for it. I did not see a 'wonderful array of cold meats' or anything else like this - there were two or three choices of cereal, some yoghurts and some croissants. On our first morning there we ordered breakfast in bed, including eggs and bacon. It arrived 15 minutes late and with a surprising lack of eggs... and indeed bacon. In fact, the eggs and bacon that we had ordered remarkably resembled croissants and bread rolls! We phoned down to see what the mix-up was and was told that they did not have any eggs or bacon that week and we should have phoned down the day before to check. Um, no... I can't actually remember ever having to do that at any hotel I have ever visited before! Perhaps I have had a narrow experience... As people have said before, if you haven't paid for breakfast to be included, then try one of the restaurants/cafes next door. They will almost certainly be cheaper and will have more choice. To sum up then, go to this hotel if you want a clean, well-positioned, reasonably priced base to explore Paris. Go with an open mind about the friendliness of the staff (i.e. don't expect any at all and then you might even be pleasantly surprised) and the size of the rooms. Eat breakfast out if at all possible and don't forget to take your own tourist maps, as I didn't see any available at the reception desk as I had expected to.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Thing That Can Happen To You, What A Mistake”
Reviews.Author: elpinikipearl
Reviews.Content: After visiting London we went to Paris for 3 nights. We chose the hotel, because we wanted a hotel in a good location and with eiffel-tower view, despite all the bad critics. Ok, lets go. There is no eiffel-tower view, unless you get your head out of the window, look to the left, and there is no trees in fron of you (we payed more to get a room with view). What a disappointment...We complained to the reception, telling that this is not what we payed for, and they told us that they were fully-booked, so they could not move us to another room, and that the hotel does not have rooms in front of the main street, it's the building on the left. I think that the man in the reception was just trying to get rid of us, he was rude and had no intention to help us with anything, he hardly answered "yes" when we asked if the metro station trocadero was closed. (we didn't even bother to inform us that only one line was closed and we didn't need to walk to the next station). We alos payed 2 euros/day extra for taxes, which was a hidden charge, but we were already really exhausted to argue for this, too. We were really happy to leave this hotel and never, ever go back there!! I'd rather stay to the streets.. The room was tiny and looked dirty and old, there was no space arround the bed, we could hardly walk or breathe in it. Bathroom was ok. Fortunately we were smart enough not to get breakfast to the hotel 13 euros/per person for some fruits and cereals? I don't think so.. Was it that bad? No...It was even worse.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Location, Will Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: 3Es
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location -- directly across the street from Trocadero metro (line 9) and across the street from the Eiffel Tower. The hop on/hop off tourist buses also stop across the street. Some rooms have a view of the Tower. Rooms are very small, as is typical for Paris hotels, but clean and quiet. When we first checked in we were given a room with a double bed that sagged in the middle (I can't believe they had not replaced that mattress yet!) to such an extreme that we asked for another room. We were given a room with 2 single beds pushed together, which was fine with us. We paid 110 euros per night for Saturday and Sunday nights. The breakfast buffet (cereal, yogurt, bread, cheese, meats, fruit) was an additional 13 euros per person. Save your money and go to the Trocadero Cafe next to the hotel and get a continental breakfast for 8.50 euros or a full breakfast including 2 fried eggs and ham for 12.50 euros. This cafe also has a fabulous view of the Eiffel Tower -- be sure to have an evening cocktail there. The staff was pleasant and generally helpful. They do push the organized tours, however, so be skeptical.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: robomom
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night , a saturday. I chose this hotel as it was located near the start of the Paris 20k race. As a woman travelling on my own ( for the first time in many years) it was perfect. A great location, 5mins walk from Air france bus at Etoile and 5mins to the Eiffel tower. Single room was clean and quiet, breakfast was filling , good coffee and near many Cafes. I will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “will try to book there again”
Reviews.Author: sammyg1rl
Reviews.Content: I have booked this hotel through booking.com (@ 100euro for double) and found it decent price for location- step out of entrance to the hotel and there's the view of the Eiffel Tower (walking distance) as well as 4 or 5 restaurants side by side. Right accross the street is access to metro/ RER! All you need is a day pass and your just minutes away from other sites! The female staff that have served us was very friendly, spoke very well english, and was informative. for a european hotel, it is very clean, beds are small, doubles and we had a spare bed (30 euro extra) put in, air conditioning at your control, no iron or coffee maker (hotel coffee?! there's delicious cappuccino available at nearby restaurants!) whole room is small, but when all you need is a clean bed to spend the night, not at all a bed deal!

Reviews.Title: “Small, friendly and well placed for the sights!”
Reviews.Author: spitfire892
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a few days in Paris, staying at this hotel. Though it is small, we found it to be comfortable and above all clean. Staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were smallish (as expected in a city), tastefully decorated and the bathroom was a good size with everything we needed in it. Breakfast was more than adequate for a continental breakfast and in a pleasant setting. Location was excellent with the Eiffel Tower just around the corner and up the road to the Arc de Triomphe, the metro station was across the road and the journey from Gard de Nord was straightforward and took no more than 35 minutes. A good choice in our opinion for a few days in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you are desparate...”
Reviews.Author: Degas
Reviews.Content: Should have been worried when the travel agency said this place was 'all we can get ' for a particular 3 day stay in Paris. First the good - location - just stumbling distance from Trocadero Metro - with a great range of cafes/bistros right next door - and a view of the Eiffel Tower out some of the street facing windows. ....and it was very clean. Rooms are small and basically furnished. Now the grim reality . The air conditioning did not work - ever -at all - during my stay despite daily reporting of the fault. - the great location made keeping the windows open unrealistic as the traffic noise was very loud. The wireless internet worked only on 1 day out of three and the sole member of staff who sits on reception seemed reluctant to be bothered to sell us the voucher needed to access it. As a finale on the last day - the lift was out of order and I had to lug my suitcase down 5 flights of stairs with no help at all. PS the credit card link was also down as I tried to check out! I paid 190 Euro a night which I feel was way o ver the top for what was on offer. I guess this could have just been bad luck - but the staff did not seem to give a toss. I won't be back - and if you have any choice at all - I would advise you to give it a miss

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good price”
Reviews.Author: k7stn
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the best western au trocadero with my finace for my birthday at the end of Jan. This is a small and compact hotel which is very close to the eiffel tower and is right across the road from the trocadero metro stop. It is an ideal base for those who want to see paris but do not want ot pay paris prices!! we are used to staying in some really amazing hotels and so was pleasantly suprised by this 3* hotel. The staff were helpful and friendly, especially the lady that works during the day. The bedrooms themselves are small but they are clean and fresh. The bathrooms look like they have been renovated recently and were lovely. We had booked a queen bed room with a courtyard view. On the first night we arrived we were given the keys to the room and when we got into the room we realised we had twin beds. I went downstairs to complain and the staff we apologetic and explained that rooms had been overbooked and we would get a queen room the next day. sure enough the next day we were called by reception at 9.30am and asked to move rooms. We ended up in a room with a king size bed that overlooked the eiffel tower. If you are loking for a comfortable hotel which is in a nice quite suburban location and which is a good price then this is perfect. It is not anything particularly fancy but its a sweet little hotel nevertheless.

Reviews.Title: “Worse Than Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: hluebner
Reviews.Content: Too bad that there is not a rating for worse than terrible. I agree with the other reviewers that the staff is the worst. Rude, sarcastic, and unhelpful. We were not made to feel welcome at all. Our recent visit to Paris at this hotel was from Dec 28 2007 through Jan 1, 2008. Husband and myself stayed in room 14; our daughter & son-in-law stayed in room 23. Even though we had checked in at 6pm, room 23 had still not been cleaned. Our bed was harder than concrete and after a full day of walking, was not a comfort. In room 23, the bed had collapsed in the middle and was evident by just looking at it! After 3 days of requesting extra pillows in English & French languages, we finally got them on our final day. Staff are not multi-lingual. They are not helpful in any tourist recommendations at all. We were told to call from our room in arranging anything, prompting excessive telephone bills. There was also a â€œhiddenâ€� 2euro charge per day on our bill which staff would not explain. The cards for internet access were not available, staff could not find them at times even though we could easily see them behind the reception desk. Excessive fee of 3euro for 20 minutes internet access! The 13euro for â€œcontinental breakfastâ€� of stale coffee & week old pastries is excessive. The shower stall has mold on the tiles; the shower splash guard allows water to spray onto the floor; the retractable clothes line within the shower was broken. Staff did not replace the used soap each day. There were no vending machines even though this is touted as a feature. Staff also discouraged us from using the sitting area. Even though we were staying in a non-smoking room, the staff would smoke in the room while they cleaned. The only convenience of this hotel is the location; but there are others just as close. The view is ok of the Eiffel Tower, but we were not in our rooms often enough to appreciate the view.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: trinty
Reviews.Content: nice hotel not posh but very nice would stay there again staff was all friendly breakfast very nice room small but clean and bathroom nice close to everything eiffel tower 2 mins around the corner

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Unfriendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: sittinpretty71
Reviews.Content: Good hotel but staff not particularly welcoming, young chap on reception merely looked up at me when I arrived and didnâ€™t say anything, seemed to have a slight smirk on his face and looked down his nose whenever I had to talk to him. The room wasn't ready at 1pm so came back later, he didn't seem to recognise me from earlier as he again just looked at me with a blank expression and I had to explain that I had returned to see if my room was ready. Maybe I am being unkind and too critical and what I perceived as coldness was what he thought was being professional. I booked a double room with an Eiffel Tower view but got a single room with courtyard view, no warning about this when I checked in Room was very nice though and was very comfortable with excellent aircon & soundpoofing. Mini bar prices were expensive, 250ml Beer was 4.80 Euro, 500ml Water 3.20 Euro, Miniature Whisky 7 Euros and a half bottle of Champagne 29 Euros. No English channels on TV and shower tray leaked water into room badly, had to use towels to soak up water from the carpet. The location is excellent right near the Eiffel Tower and a stone's throw from the Trocadero Metro. Next time I think I'll stay in the Marais district though, it seemed a little livelier and had more heart. The Trocadero area is very safe and upmarket however. If the staff had been friendlier (a welcoming smile and a 'bonjour!' would have made all the difference) than I would have probably given this hotel five stars. As it was I left the hotel feeling slightly unwelcome and with no desire to return, what a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Three-star hotel with one-star staff”
Reviews.Author: Chateaubriand
Reviews.Content: After searching several hotels, we decided to stay here based on several factors, including the good location, the Eiffel Tower view, and the familiarity with Best Western. First, the good: rooms are clean, fashionably designed, moderately sized. Eiffel-tower view (if you request it). Metro literally outside the door. Excellent A/C. Great location (Trocadero, 16e) which in my opinion is a great place to stay--it's a clean, quiet, safe, upper-class area, close to the Eiffel Tower/Champs Elysees/Arc d'Triomphe. The bad: the staff is easily the biggest issue. In particular, the Armenian fellow with black-framed glasses was extremely sarcastic and unhelpful throughout our visit. Another staff member, the older blond lady in charge of the hotel, was also unhelpful--we asked for help with a car rental and she instead recommended we give them a call with the phone upstairs. Result: the 15 minute call costed 16 euros. The money wasn't an issue, but we felt misled and taken advantage of. The one exception would be a young lady named Charlotte who seems to work on weekends--she was very nice and helpful. The bad, continued: we had a dud sink that was never fixed even though we repeatedly notified the staff. Also, upon arriving, the tub was dirty with a red-brown stain, plus I had one incident of a stained/dirty towel. All in all, it's an okay hotel. The best things about it are the peaceful/convenient location and its proximity to the metro right outside the door. Other than that, the staff's attitude and unhelpfulness somewhat dampened the overall experience. If you're looking for a charming, cheerful place to stay, then look elsewhere. But if all you need is a safe choice with a bed to spend the night, then you should be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: Young-Traveller-19
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel last summer for 6 days, and we are returning to the hotel next week for 4 days, which is evidence to its draw. We mainly booked this hotel for its location, almost every night after a lovely evening we lay under the eiffel tower, or by the huge fountains next to the eiffel tower, listening to music, watching the eiffel tower flash, chatting and people watching. Often a little tipsy. Then wandering a 5-10 minute walk home to the hotel along the fountains, the river Seine, and across the trocadero. The Trocadero itself is really great, it is just a square but it is covered in street entertainment like human statues or crazy breakdancers. The street sellers get a little tiring but you get used to it. This hotel is loterally right next to a metro stop which is reallly handy for getting around, and dragging luggage. The breakfasts are average but sufficiant and there is a quaint square to eat it in, the rooms are fairly small but nice enough, and what you expect in Paris really unless you spend thousands. It was great to chill out in the room with a great veiw of the Eiffel tower. Highlights of the trip are On a particularly hot day we - and many others - went paddling in the fountains by the eiffel tower; driving around the grounds of Versaille in a golf buggy, veiwing the champs ellyse from the arc de triomphe, and eating a picnic under the eiffel tower. It is a lovely city and I can't wait to return next week. Tips:- - Do not to buy the champagne that the men sell you around the tower because it tastes disgusting. - The TV in the rooms has some sexy/rude french channels if that's your sort of thing. - Unless you're fluent, don't bother trying any tourist French at any of the tourist attractions because they will laugh or get aggitated. - Don't go on a bus tour, go on a boat tour. - A walk along the Mouln Rouge is really interesting even if you don't see a show.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: dixiebelle06
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the BW au Trocadero on July 7th and 8th. The hotel is in a wonderful location and the view from our room of the Eiffel Tower was beautiful. I also loved the room. It was very clean and the decor very nice. The bathroom was nice as well, modern and a pretty good size. We had two large windows that open completely and offer a great view of the Eiffel Tower. The Trocadero metro stop is really, really close. There are also several good restaurants close by. The hotel is in a perfect spot. The Arc de Triomphe and the Champs ElysÃ©es are a 10 minute walk. The Eiffel Tower and the Seine are just across the street. ( and down some major steps) I really loved the hotel and the location. I would stay there again even with the few problems we had. The only problem with this hotel is the staff. First of all, I e-mailed the hotel a few weeks before our trip to find out about the cost of internet access. I was told to visit the service provider (www.sfr.com) website to get the rates. I did this and the rates were reasonable (15 euro for 3 hrs over 48 hr period) so I brought my laptop. ( we wanted to call home via internet) Well, these are not actually the rates. SFR and BW blocked general access and you have to buy a card from the hotel to access the internet. The cards cost 3 euro for 20 minutes. I complained about this but was told that this is just how it works- no apology. ( I even sent the e-mail back that was sent to me with the bad info.) One evening, I wanted to buy another 3 euro card and was told right away, the clerk didn't even look, that they didn't have any more. I knew this wasn't true because I saw a huge stack of the cards the last time I bought one. I had to practically beg the guy to look for the cards, then had to actually show him where to find the cards!! I knew more about the front desk than he did!! Lastly, it took 30 minutes to check out because they couldn't get the credit card machine to work. Other than those things, which I guess are minor, the place was great. Oh, yea, the airconditioner is GREAT...nice and cool. ( If you are searching for hotels with Tower views, I recently stayed at the Hotel Splendid Tour Eiffel and the BW au Trocadero is much better.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KarenNewport
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night holiday with my husband and son.Had rooms 24 and 25, which were very clean and plenty big enough for a short stay.Found the staff to be pleasant, had no problems so didn't really need to bother them. Booked the break through Cresta so had breakfast included in the price,the usual things- fresh rolls and croissants ,jams,cheese, meats ,cereals. Lots of tourists wandering around till very late at night so felt very safe around this area. Quite a few places to eat in immediate area and a lovely bakery on Ave. Kleber (the next street). Cafe Kleber (on next corner) we weren't impressed with...tough steak, cold chips and sauce,a bit like a supermarket cafeteria.If you just want a drink and sit outside it's ok but very noisy. There is also another Cafe Kleber about half way along Ave. Kleber on left hand side of the road.This we found to be very good, not a great deal of choice on the menu but the fillet steak was excellent.(bien cuit - well done is actually quite red in the middle) Pub Kleber - the food and service were very good but don't ask for a large beer as you'll get a litre and be charged almost 16 euros for it !!! Fra Diavolo 73 Ave Kleber - great service and absolutely gorgeous food.Had lovely home made pizza and Tiramasu washed down with Chardonnay.Tables not too close together and really nice atmosphere. Couple of supermarkets really close (I'd recommend buying your soft drinks etc here to take out with you as they are very expensive to buy near the tourist attractions.) The metro is just outside ,Very frequent and easy connections to all the sights of Paris. All in all had a brilliant time and would definitely consider returning to this great little hotel

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review of BW Au Tracadero”
Reviews.Author: Greengal06
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Paris where we stayed at the Best Western Au Trocadero for 9 nights. I chose this hotel based on the reviews from Trip Advisor. It was safe and clean which are most important to me. The water pressure along with the very hot water was great! It was very convenient having the metro stop directly across the street. However, the staff was not the friendliest. Our first impression of Raznick was not the best, but he turned out to be quite friendly and talkative during our stay. He was quite humorous! There were two young gentlemen that worked in the evenings that were not friendly at all. I wasn't even sure that they spoke English. The hotel staff had booked a shuttle to take us from the hotel to the airport but we forgot to ask if they took credit cards. We asked the young man at the desk if he could call to confirm that they took credit cards. (We were out of cash and would need to get more before leaving the next morning.) He insisted that they did, but no where on the shuttle service's brochure did it say. He finally, after practically begging, called. Good thing he did because they only took cash! When we went to check out the next morning, the other young man working said we needed to pay for our stay. Since we had booked this trip online and paid for it back in August 2006, we didn't understand why we would have to pay. He insited on seeing proof that we had paid and showed him our receipt. He still insisted on needing a credit card even though the hotel's records had a credit card listed. I finally gave in and gave him my credit card since the shuttle was waiting for us and we needed to leave. This was not how I wanted my fabulous trip to end. C'est la vie!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Annachy89
Reviews.Content: It was worth spending a bit to stay here, I loved the room we had. The view was of the wall in the middle of buildings, but this didn't mater as everything else was top notch. The staff are bilingual so there is virtually no problem in communicating and they were friendly and open to chat to. The lounge area was lovely, ideal for sitting in with a drink between outings. As two young girls in a strange country and big city, we were made to feel utterly safe and did not worry about our things or about ourselves. There are half a dozen great cafes, a metro stop and a couple of presse (for newspapers and magazines, although Le Figaro and the Guardian are free in the breakfast bar) within 2 minutes walk. The location is ideal for exploring Paris and is 10 minutes from the Eiffel Tower. I hope to get the chance to stay here again and definitely recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little place”
Reviews.Author: rudoggy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here from 03-14 through 03-19. The room is very small, but the bathroom made up for it. The water pressure was very strong. I didn't like the fact that there was no shower curtain, the shower plate glass that is there only went about a quarter of the way. The t.v. was small, 13 in screen, and there are no english channels in the evening, only one channel is in english in the morning, a European financial one at that, but since we were barely in the room at all, who cares. We stayed in room 43, it had a view of the street below and of the Eiffel Tower. Since we didn't get in until late every evening, the street noise was minimal, if non-existant. The bed itself though was terrible. It sags in the middle. If possible, stay away from that room. Most of the people at the reception desk speak english, but the cleaning women don't. One morning we woke at around 10 am and were still in the room when the cleaning woman came to our room and got mad because we weren't out yet! We just had to laugh it off. You have to give them credit, though, they really keep your bathroom clean and the room tidy. But they use the same sheets the whole time you are there. High marks go to Cedric, he works the reception desk at night. He is really interested in making your stay as pleasant as possible. If you see him, make sure you say hello. The number 1 thing about this hotel, the thing the trumps everything else, is the location. You can't beat it. As all the other reviews here have stated, it is within spitting distance of a metro stop, which in Paris, is like gold. And the area of Paris the hotel is in, in the Trocadero area, is top-notch. You can't beat it. We paid 106 euros a night, and everyone we know who has been to Paris agrees that it was highway robbery, on OUR part! Of course, in the summer, everything is double, or more, but overall, it was a good value, and as small as the room is, there are way smaller ones around. So, the room is adequate, and clean, and the location can't be beat for the price. I would gladly stay there again, but not in room 43 with that saggy bed!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: wyldedixie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from 03/11/07 to 03/15/07. When we first saw the room, we were a little shocked at the size--minuscule! However, we quickly discovered that the bathroom itself was almost as large as the sleeping area. We did receive a double bed as requested with a great view of the Eiffel Tower. Our room was non-smoking, and housekeeping did an excellent job of keeping the room clean and tidy, which was a challenge given the fact that the hubby and myself are somewhat messy with our room when traveling. Room details: The bed was comfortable and clean, but the mattress was a little firmer than I like. The hubby likes a firmer mattress, so it suited him just fine. There was a small desk with a writing area, and the room did have a wireless Internet connection for a small fee depending upon your requested usage. We had an in-room safe, which we did use, and we had an extra blanket and pillows as well. There was plenty of closet and drawer space to store our clothing. The room also featured a mini-bar, which had competitive pricing with the bars and restaurants in the area. I was most pleased with the bathroom. It had a deep tub with a shower (removable shower head). I was not thrilled with the shower guard, however, since it was quite difficult to take a shower without getting water all over the bathroom floor. The vanity area was adequate while getting ready in the morning. The best part about our hotel experience here was the location. We were conveniently located right across the street from a Metro stop (Trocadero on the 6 line). The staff spoke English quite well, and a breakfast was available each morning for 13.00 Euros, although we never used this feature. There were several shops, cafes, restaurants, bars, and boulaneries/patisseries within walking distance. We visited one boulangerie every morning for a croissant before heading off to tour. The hotel was quite small, but that made our experience all the more enjoyable. We only saw the other guests a few times, which was also enjoyable. We almost felt like we had the place to ourselves. We would definitely stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Au Trocadero
HotelInfo.Address: 3 Avenue Raymond Poincare | 16th Arr., 75116 Paris, France
